info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 5:29AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Greenville, Spartanburg, Cherokee and northern Union Counties through 600 AM EST... At 529 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles west of Greenville Downtown to 9 miles southwest of Spartanburg to 9 miles northeast of Union. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Spartanburg, Gaffney, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Berea and Five Forks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
